Privacy Policy

Last updated: 6/20/2025

PRIVACY POLICY

Effective Date: 2025-01-01 NurivaTech (“we,” “us,” or “our”) is committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy describes the types of information we collect from you, how we use and protect that information, and the rights you have with respect to your personal data. We strive to comply with all applicable privacy and data protection laws, including (where relevant) the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) as amended by the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA), the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA), and other local laws that may apply to our Services.

1. SCOPE OF DATA COLLECTION

1.1 Personal Data

We collect personal data that is necessary to provide and improve our services, including but not limited to:

  • Contact Information : Names, email addresses, phone numbers
  • Organizational Affiliation : Team names, school or club affiliation
  • Activity Data : Athletic goals, training schedules, performance metrics
  • Social Media Profiles : Links or usernames for platforms you choose to connect
  • Media Files : Images, videos, or other user-uploaded content
  • AI-Generated Analyses and Reports : Automated insights derived from your usage and data

1.2 Data Collected from Minors

  • Enhanced Protection : We apply heightened data protection measures for minors under applicable law.
  • Minimal Data Storage : Except for a minor’s name, email, and phone number (necessary for account management), all other data for minors remains on their device unless a parent or legal guardian expressly authorizes additional data processing by NurivaTech.
  • Parental Consent : We will not collect, share, or otherwise process a minor’s data beyond what is described herein without verifiable parental or legal guardian consent.

1.3 Additional Types of Information

In addition to the categories above, we may also collect or receive:

  • Device & System Data : Technical information about your device (e.g., IP address, operating system, browser type, app usage data).
  • Usage & Log Data : Time spent on pages, features used, referral URLs, timestamps, and other analytics data.
  • Location Data : Approximate or precise geolocation data (e.g., via IP geolocation, GPS, Wi-Fi). You can manage or disable location sharing at the device or app level.
  • Third-Party Integrations : Data from social media networks (e.g., if you sign in with Google, Apple, Facebook, etc.) or from business partners and analytics providers.

2. LAWFUL BASES FOR PROCESSING

We process your data based on one or more of the following legal grounds (as applicable under relevant data protection laws, such as the GDPR or CCPA):

  1. Consent : Where you have given clear consent for us to process your personal data for a specific purpose.
  2. Contractual Necessity : Where processing is necessary to provide the services you have requested.
  3. Legitimate Interests : Where processing is in our legitimate interests (e.g., to improve our services) and does not override your data protection rights.
  4. Legal Obligations : Where we need to comply with a legal or regulatory requirement.

3. HOW WE USE YOUR DATA

We use the collected data to:

  • Provide, maintain, and improve our services and features
  • Personalize your experience with tailored recommendations and analyses
  • Communicate important updates , respond to inquiries, and provide customer support
  • Conduct internal research and analytics to enhance user experience
  • Comply with legal and regulatory requirements Additionally, we may:
  • Enhance AI or Machine Learning Features : Where you engage with AI-driven functionalities, your inputs (e.g., prompts, usage patterns) may be used (in anonymized or pseudonymized form) to help improve our recommendation algorithms and service quality.
  • Marketing & Promotional Messages : Subject to your consent, we may send newsletters, offers, or event invitations. You can opt out at any time.

4. DATA SECURITY AND OWNERSHIP

4.1 Security Measures

  • We implement encryption, hashing, and other industry-standard security protocols to protect personal information.
  • User accounts are anonymized to reduce the risk of identifying you in case of unauthorized access.
  • We regularly review and update our security measures to address evolving threats.

4.2 Ownership and Control

  • Your Rights : You retain ownership of your personal data. You may request access, modification, or deletion of your personal information at any time by contacting us at support@nurivatech.com.
  • Minors’ Rights : For minors, a parent or legal guardian must exercise these rights on the minor’s behalf.
  • Data Retention : We retain your information only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, or as required by law.

4.3 Data Retention (Extended)

  • We keep your data only for as long as needed to provide our Services and as required to comply with legal obligations, resolve disputes, or enforce agreements.
  • Once data is no longer needed, we take steps to securely destroy, anonymize, or pseudonymize it. Residual copies in backups may persist for a limited time before they are fully purged.

5. DATA SHARING AND CONTROL

5.1 User-Directed Sharing

  • Your data is shared solely at your explicit direction. You decide if and when to share personal data with specific subscribers, coaches, or organizations.
  • You have ongoing control to adjust these permissions within your account settings.

5.2 Types of Shared Data

Depending on your instructions and usage of our services, the data you choose to share may include:

  • Sports fitness and skill levels, training progress
  • Practice frequency and duration
  • Health status and history (including injuries or illnesses, as optionally detailed by you)
  • Social media posts
  • Uploaded media files (images and videos)
  • AI-generated analyses and reports derived from your usage

5.3 Additional Disclosures

We may also share data in the following circumstances:

  • Service Providers & Vendors : We use third parties (e.g., hosting providers, analytics tools, payment processors) who process data on our behalf under strict confidentiality obligations.
  • Business Transactions : In connection with mergers, acquisitions, reorganizations, or asset sales, user information may be transferred subject to confidentiality arrangements. We will notify you if your data becomes subject to a different Privacy Policy as a result of such a transaction.
  • Legal & Safety Requirements : We may disclose data to comply with a legal obligation, protect our rights and property, address emergencies, or assist in investigations (e.g., fraud or security threats). We do not sell your personal data. If in the future we engage in any practices considered a “sale” or “sharing” under certain privacy laws, we will provide a clear method for you to opt out.

6. DATA HOSTING AND COMPLIANCE

6.1 Opt-In Hosting

  • We may offer the option to have your data securely hosted by NurivaTech. If you opt in, we will process, store, and manage your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws (including the GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant regulations).
  • You can withdraw your consent for hosting at any time by contacting us at support@nurivatech.com. However, withdrawal of consent may affect your ability to use certain features of our services.

6.2 International Data Transfers

  • If you are located outside the country where our servers or service providers are located, your personal data may be transferred across international borders.
  • Where required by law, we implement appropriate safeguards (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses, adequacy decisions, or Binding Corporate Rules) to ensure lawful transfer of personal data with adequate protection.

7. COOKIES AND SIMILAR TECHNOLOGIES

(If Applicable)

  • We may use cookies, pixels, or other similar technologies to collect usage data and improve user experience. You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings. For more information on how we use cookies, please see our Cookie Policy (if available).
  • These technologies help us recognize your browser or device , maintain session continuity, personalize content, analyze usage, and deliver or measure ads (where applicable).

8. CHILDREN’S PRIVACY

We recognize the importance of protecting the privacy of minors. As noted:

  • We only collect the minimal personal data of minors necessary for account creation (name, phone number, and email).
  • Any additional data related to minors is treated with enhanced protection and remains on the child’s device unless further permissions are granted by a parent or legal guardian.
  • We comply with all applicable laws and regulations regarding children’s privacy, such as COPPA in the United States, where applicable.

8.1 Parental Rights & Controls

  • Parents or guardians can review the data we have about their child, request its deletion, or revoke any consent previously given.
  • If you have any questions or requests regarding your child’s data, please contact us at support@nurivatech.com.

9. YOUR RIGHTS AND CHOICES

Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have certain rights regarding your personal data, including the right to:

  • Access and obtain a copy of your personal data
  • Request rectification or erasure of your personal data
  • Object to or restrict the processing of your personal data
  • Withdraw your consent at any time where processing is based on consent
  • Receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format To exercise any of these rights, or if you have questions about how your data is processed, please contact us at [insert contact details]. We will respond to your request consistent with applicable law.

9.1 Region-Specific Disclosures

  • California Residents (CCPA/CPRA) : You may have the right to request disclosure of the personal information we have collected about you, ask us to delete that information, or correct inaccurate data. You can also opt out of any “sale” or “sharing” of your personal information if applicable. We will not discriminate against you for exercising your rights.
  • EEA/UK/Switzerland (GDPR) : You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local Data Protection Authority if you believe we have not handled your personal data lawfully.
  • Other Jurisdictions : Local laws may grant you additional rights. We strive to comply with all relevant regulations in the regions where we do business.

10. CHANGES TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY

We reserve the right to update or modify this Privacy Policy at any time to reflect changes to our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. If we make material changes, we will notify users through a prominent notice (e.g., via email or a notice on our platform) prior to the change becoming effective. Your continued use of our services after any modifications to this Privacy Policy will signify your acceptance of such changes.

11. CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at:

  • Email : [Insert relevant email]
  • Address : 123 Innovation Drive, Tech City, CA 12345
  • Phone : [Insert phone number, if applicable]

12. ADDITIONAL PROVISIONS

12.1 Do Not Track (DNT)

Some browsers transmit “Do Not Track” (DNT) signals. We currently do not alter our practices in response to DNT headers or similar mechanisms. We continue to review evolving standards and may update our approach if required by law or best practices.

12.2 Public Forums and User-Generated Content

Any content you post publicly (e.g., in forums, comment sections, or through publicly accessible links) may be seen and used by others. We encourage you to exercise caution before sharing personal details in such public areas.

12.3 Accountability & Governance

We maintain internal governance processes to oversee data protection compliance, including staff training and periodic audits or risk assessments. We also conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for high-risk data processing where required by law.

12.4 Complaints & Dispute Resolution

Should you have a complaint about our privacy practices, please contact us first at [insert contact details]. We will work to resolve it in a fair and timely manner. Where mandated by law, you may also have the right to escalate your complaint to a supervisory authority, regulator, or official agency within your jurisdiction. By using our services, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy and agree to our collection, use, and disclosure of your information as described herein.
